name: Kayuh Bicycles & Cafe
categories: Bagels, Food, Coffee & Tea, Active Life, Bike Repair/Maintenance, Local Services, Bike Rentals, Mountain Biking, Bikes, Shopping, Sporting Goods

text:
my partner and i both bought our bikes from Kayuh. The owner, Henry, is both kind and knowledgeable. Since then, my partner's bike needed a tune up, which also was a great customer experience with an efficient turn around time. 

even if you aren't in the market for a bike, the cafe is solid. i love their smoothies. also sometimes they get donuts in which are delicious!
Awesome experience. Very knowledgeable staff. Extremely reasonable prices for products and repairs. Definitely my new favorite bike shop. Muffins are great too

Excellent Philly bike shop! They ended up building two bikes for me so I could test ride them both. Kayuh was very communicative throughout the whole process too. I'm thrilled with my purchase and look forward to exploring the city by bike. Their prices are really affordable and everyone is helpful. I was worried about being intimidated going in, but everyone was very welcoming! I highly recommend this bike shop for any maintenance or gear you may need

These folks went above and beyond to assemble my ebike (electric bike)! 

I was gifted an ebike for Christmas and the package was HEAVY! The place around the corner wouldn't pick up the bike. However Kayuh picked up the bike, assembled it (took about a week but that's fine... we're in a pandemic), and offered to drop it back off. 

They have pick-up and delivery days and you can fill out a form online..I got a quick email response to confirm pick up! While Henry, one of the owners, picked up the bike - I also needed a bigger helmet for my hair and head. He knew the best size,  emailed me options to choose, and put in a special order for an XL helmet. 

My bike was done in about a week and an employee answered all of my beginner ebike owner questions without hesitation. My helmet came in the following week- it fit perfectly!

Although I haven't gotten anything there, they have a cute cafe operating for takeout too! 

Even though there's another bike shop around the corner, I really loved how I was treated by the folks here and will come back for service and, maybe, grab a drink and snack.
amazingly knowledgeable employees, really know the community and work well with their customers. happily walked me through how to do some basic maintenance on my bike. and really great cafe too.

Helped me out with getting a great bike when everywhere online was sold out! Very professional and responsive back and forth via email. Day of pickup I left the shop and immediately hit a nail and got a flat. Took the bike back and they fixed it up immediately for free. Friendly and kind team! Could not recommend this place more.

These guys are DA BEST, ever! During Covid, they even picked up my bike for free and dropped it off after a couple of days all tuned up. They always call ahead to provide an estimate and are very professional and upfront/transparent. 5 out of 5 stars!

I've been living in the city for nearly ten years, and planned on purchasing a bike in year one or two... I even got a bike helmet soon after moving to the city (safety first!). Alas, I never bought the bike. Flash forward to the present pandemic times, and there's nothing I have been wanting more than the sweet, sweet freedom to move around the city a little further than where my own two feet will take me. 

I'm so happy with my experience at Kayuh! They started popping up on my twitter feed recently, and I noticed they were offering free delivery and pick up for bike repairs and purchases. They seemed really friendly and helpful which is what made me check out their website and get in touch. I worked with Henry and, after some emails back and forth, I selected a bike and he placed an order. The entire process from when I submitted a contact form to when I had my bike was about a week. That's pretty awesome, if you ask me. 

I ended up picking up my bike in person so I could test ride it a bit. Also, I was able to add on a couple necessary accessories including a bike lock (with a bike mount) and a water bottle holder. 

The bike is a bright, happy shade of orange, with really attractive tan accents. I rode home across town while my husband drove the car. Though I've only been on one additional ride so far, I can't wait for better weather so I can really get out and explore. 

So happy to finally have a bike and I look forward to working with Kayuh again for all my bicycle needs in the future!

This place is the best! It's a hidden gem tucked away in Fairmount. It's one of me and my friend's favorite places to go to grab a quick coffee, smoothie, or bagel in the morning. It's cute & affordable & has the best customer service around. Like seriously the people there are the best. I highly recommend to anyone in the area!

My favorite neighborhood coffee shop, always good service and never too busy or a long wait, which is good when i'm in a rush.  It also has good seating near the bike shop area in back that is a good place to get some work done.  Food and drinks are consistently yummy.

It's not everyday you find a small little joint like this that also doubles as a bike repair shop. Had a blueberry coffee crumb cake which was delicious and a smoothie. Gave it 4 stars since the smoothie was a bit pricey for the size.
This is my favorite Cafe within the city for sure. The bike crew always comes through & I love the food! Amazing atmosphere. I look forward to my daily visits.
Wrote something negative, received an informative reply, and changed my review. Thanks for the thoughtful response, gang!

This place is awesome! The staff is super friendly, they always do an amazing job and very professional. Every time I need some job done on my bike, I bring it here. They also have a coffee shop on site which makes it super convenient. Keep up the good work.
Best place to get coffee and your bike fitted. Super friendly atmosphere. Warm and welcoming. Just with bikes and information you can use. Truly an asset to the neighborhood.

This place is awesome. I don't bike or anything, but there's a lot of other things to love about Kayuh. Coffee's good, friendly staff, breakfast sandwiches, smoothies, pastries and bagels with spreads.

Such a cool quirky concept - a cafe inside a bike shop. I stop at Kuyah when I am going to hop on the trolley to travel up or down Girard. It's the perfect location for a pre-travel snack.

The coffee is good. The pastries are very tasty. The blueberry crumb cake is my favorite! 

The staff is always very friendly and accommodating. It has not been very crowded when I have been there so we can usually chat about the pastries and which one I should try.
Cool spot close to home for a cup of coffee. I've had some of their breakfast treats which are fresh and good.

My local shop!!! (as local as it gets-1 floor down, few doors over.) Delicious sandwiches, and great coffee-and super awesome friendly staff! Good selection of stuff for vegans like my roommate too 

bonus: they do morning bike rides starting from this shop on the weekend too that they organize! I havnt yet, but planning to try one out!

This is just an all around great shop. Brought my bike in to find a small part and Izzy dug around in the back and found it. Ever since he's been a problem solver and all around good businessman. Plus the bagels are good too!

Kayuh is a must for coffee lovers and/or bikers in the Fairmount/Francisville area. 

The owner, Izzat, and the rest of the staff/baristas always makes me feel at home and like I'm part of a community. 

Try the Vietnamese coffee, cold or hot, or the Cold Brew coffee! It's the best!!

PS: I don't have any stock in Kayuh but my nickname there is "The Owner" so tell them the owner sent you!!!

Super cool spot. Everyone in the place is nice, employees and customers alike. Not much of biker but you don't have to know much about bikes,the workers take care of everything.The cold brew coffee is one of the best I've ever had. I am now going to be forced to stop here every time i pass by for a cold brew.

Kayuh Bicylces is..

-THE OVERALL BEST BIKE SHOP in town!
-Most affordable bike repair in town!
-Most affordable cafe in Fairmount!
-Staffed by the most amazing human beings in the world

They have a great selection of breakfasty treats and plenty of beautiful bikes and parts that will make any avid cyclist or foodie drool.

***PATRONIZE THIS LOCAL ESTABLISHMENT***

I stumbled upon this place by luckily being in the area and I'm definitely happy to have found it. They're super welcoming and down to earth. They offer exception service for all your custom bike needs and they go above and beyond for their customers. Very knowledgeable and very helpful all around. I needed to get my bike built and tuned up in a hurry and Izzy was so helpful and even let me bring it in early so I could have it by the end of day. He did an amazing job, the bike feels awesome riding! I recommend anyone looking for help to go here first! I've been to other bike shops and they kind of look down on you a bit if you don't have as much knowledge as them. But Izzy was awesome hands down  and made sure I was all set before I left. Also there pastries at their cafe are to die for. I recommend anyone to try the blueberry coffee cake! Great staff, great service, and overall great friendly environment I will definitely be a returning customer!

Really cool space. The bike/coffee shop combo works and really fits in with the neighborhood. The staff (maybe owners?) are friendly and helpful. I ordered a three shot latte with almond milk, no foam and the helpful barista got it right. Latte was delicious. Bathrooms are gender neutral. I was in and out in five minutes. I wish they had Stevia as a coffee sweetener. I'll be back!

I lived down the street and couldn't be happier with this place. Izzat is super friendly and does a great job being part of the community.

Get your bike tuned and try the Vietnamese coffee!

Best bike shop around. Incredibly friendly staff who will talk you through all your bike's issues and quote you the fairest prices you didn't dare dream of. Extremely responsive via phone and comes through on time every time.

Anytime you put bikes and my favorite (non-alcoholic) beverage together, you're going to end up with a happy Toni. I love the vibe of this place, and the prices on drinks are great.  I didn't really compare bike equipment prices, but they also only seemed to have a small supply going on. My friend and I both ordered an almond milk latte (don't judge my granola tendencies).  The barista was extremely friendly, and I loved that they were just about to head out for a Sunday morning ride. Next time I'll bring the fixie along :)
Great prices and incredibly fast service. Got a flat about 30 min before class, went in and out in about 10 min. Wasn't late to class either.

I moved to the area a couple months ago and when I got a flat and needed a tune up on my bike I came here because it was the closest bike shop to me. I just popped in and they were able to help me right away and before I could even finish my coffee my bike was finished and for a more than reasonable price. After that, this place has become my go to shop. The coffee is great, the people couldn't be more helpful, and I don't have a bad thing to say about this place. I'd highly recommend this shop to anyone.

I am a huge fan of this place, both for coffee and for bike repair. They are incredibly helpful and kind. They are down-to-Earth, and unlike a lot of bike shops I've been to, they are not pretentious and don't make you feel stupid about your bike. Their coffee is yummy and great priced! I have been here multiple times for bike work (and coffee) and continue to be impressed by their service.

A friend recommended this place to get our bikes assembled and fine-tuned, and we decided to go for it after reading so many great reviews. They really are pretty great - price is quite reasonable, and they work fast and effectively. We dropped off our bikes on a Friday shortly before they were closing, and I got a call the next day letting me know they were ready to go.

Jesse helped us adjust both of our bikes when we picked them up, and after I put them on my bike rack, he helped me make sure they were secured well before we drove off. He was really helpful all-around!

It's also cool how they have organized bike rides, and that there's a coffee shop right there! I'll have to try a drink next time I'm there!

About a year ago I moved across the street from Kayuh and ever since then it's been a part of my daily routine. The coffee is delicious as well as the assortment of other beverages they offer (my favorite being the iced Moroccan mint tea). All of the employees are wonderful, always helping me out with a quick fix of my bike whenever I need it. The owner, Izzy, is the most friendly and welcoming neighbor anyone could ask for! 10/10 recommend stopping by whether you need a tune up on your bike or a coffee to start your day!
I went to 5 bike shops in one day, trying to fix my bike and buy a helmet. This one was the best.

BEST PLACE TO GET A BIKE, TAKE YOUR BIKE, GRAB A BITE OR TALK ABOUT BIKES! Seriously, I have been going to Kayuh since it first opened and I have never had a poor experience. Izzat brings so much love and energy in what he does you see it reflecting in the entire store; they all have that special enthusiasm that I hope lives with this team forever. The best thing about the shop is they focus on really helping you rather than simply selling you every single product they can. I have been to shops that make the job harder than it needs to be and by doing so attempt to sell you as much as they can. Not at Kayuh, expect honesty, courtesy, respect and quality. #Facts

Kayuh is the best. Izzat and his team go above and beyond to make sure your bike needs are met and you are ready to ride!

I bring my bike here every summer before I start riding a lot again and they are always super helpful and get my bike all tuned up for some long rides.

Plus, you can sip on a coffee while you wait!

THIS BIKE SHOP IS A DREAM. 

After sadly moving away from the neighborhood last summer I now have over 8 bike shops that are closer to my house including one that is literally directly across the street from my house. Yet I still hands-down and without a seconds hesitation make the 5 mile trip across town to Kayuh every. single. time. not exaggerating. it's worth it. I've been going to Kayuh for 2 years now.

Number one draw: the mechanics themselves. They are amazingly kind, accurate, articulate, helpful, and talented. Both the work itself and their advice is on-point and impeccable. They've always been happy to show me what's going on with my bike, explain my options when I'm on a budget, and when the shop is quiet they've even walked me through the fix so I can venture at it on my own the next time. Also they're hilarious and total jokesters... 

Secondly, the prices are great and easily compare with all the other shops around town.

(also total bonus there's a coffee shop there while you wait for your bike service! the baristas are friendly and the coffee is delicious!)

As a queer, female identified but gender-queer presenting human this space is hella safe and so welcoming. As someone that doesn't do a whole lot of their own repairs, no one there has ever treated me like I don't know what i'm talking about with my bike  ...even when I genuinely don't! THANK YOU! :) I've sat in the shop many days and I've watched them treat every single person that comes in that door amazingly and with total respect. I'd give this place one jillion stars if I could.

Truly a bicycling-community gem

Support your rad local POC owned and operated businesses.
Fast and friendly service, local Temple Grad. Awesome coffee and pastries. Highly recommended!

I continue to love Kayuh Bicycles and am so happy with their service. They treat my little old clunker with the same care and love they give to sleek performance bikes. I have stopped by with silly little problems and major overhaul needs; the service and kindness are consistent and awesome. I can't say enough about Izzat and the crew at Kayuh! Last thing: the coffee is excellent :)

This review is long overdue, because I absolutely love Kayuh!!!! I live in south Philly and there are plenty of good bike shops in my neighborhood, but after my experiences at Kayuh, I prefer to take the ride up to Girard ave. The owner, Izzat, and his staff, specifically Henry, are so kind and knowledgeable. I have taken my bike to other shops for lots of reasons but for months I was feeling and hearing the same concerning issue and I always mentioned it to the other shops, but the problem never went away. I asked Iz for a tune up and asked him about the consistent problem. Iz was the only person that said he felt something was wrong with the bottom bracket. After fully explaining what the issues could be and taking out the bottom bracket to see it's condition Henry and I decided it needed to be replaced. They explained all of the issues my bike had in simple terms and allowed me to decide what I wanted to have done. The moment I got back on my bike I knew the problem had been resolved and my bike ran and still runs like new!!!!  I have to say I also love going to Kayuh for their coffee (get the Vietnamese coffe) and their special guest nights. Always a good scene in there and the fairest prices I've encountered.
Cool dudes did a great job! Good advice and the dude at the counter said "hey al... be careful" and it kind of felt like he just gave me the keys to his Oldsmobile. Tight.

I'm a new biker who has been intimidated in the past by other bike stores judging my novice bike and lack of bike knowledge. After my experience at Kayuh I want to hang out there more often! Izzat and team are patient, knowledgeable and are running a true community experience. As this community grows, Kayuh will be a staple as the community grows around it. If you've been looking for a welcoming vibe and a place with expert knowledge to take your bike look no further. Pop in for a cup of coffee too, delicious. Thanks Izzat and Kayuh!

I go out of my way to bring my bike here because of the awesome customer service and great prices. They recently added a coffee and pastries counter to the store which makes it a great place to hang out, see what's happening in the community and to chat about bikes. The coffee is La Colombe I think and I had a very flaky delicious croissant.
Seriously, there's no where else I rather go. Great atmosphere, great conversation and great people. Izzat is the man.

So cute! Julio and Izzat are super friendly and sweet,  the coffee is great and so is my bagel! Which is good cuz a crappy bagels are just awful. My friend who is a biker (I am not) spoke to Izzat for a while about bikes and he seemed really knowledgeable and all that at least from what I can tell. I had a sweet veitnamese coffee and then Julio gave us this nice blood orange hibiscus iced tea for us to try.  Really nice :) oh and there's wifi!!! :)
Easily my favorite bike shop. The guys are very helpful and accommodating. Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to get back on a bike or fine tune their current set up.
Great latte coffee and toasted bagels. Plus open SUPER early if you need your bicycle repaired before work.

Kayuh Bicycles is my #1 spot to get my bike fixed in the Fairmount area. The prices are by far the cheapest in the area, and the service is unbeatable. I have been going for three years and never disappointed.

Just needed a replacement inner tube, and friendly staff volunteered assistance and made sure I got one that would fit (tube size and valve length). Good price. Cool that they also have a coffee bar. I will stop by again.

I've been using this place for bike repairs for about a year, and have consistently been impressed by their personable service and reasonable prices. So confident have I become in biking that I went ahead and sold my car, and Kayuh has been a big help in that.

Case in point - last time I went in, I had gotten my derailleur caught in my spokes (for whatever reason) and thought it was going to be at least a $50 fix. Iz (the owner) took a look and estimated about what I expected, but when I got it back (in a few business hours, which was ahead of what he had estimated) he did a bunch of other fixes but only charged me for the new derailleur- $25. That's just one example of Kayuh's above-and-beyond service, a welcome relief for someone like me who is constantly concerned about getting ripped off by shady businesses.

Plus, Iz is a Temple grad (go Owls), so that about seals it for anyone living in North Philly.
